paragraphs.name: 0a01
paragraphs.text: 1. Gradients are memorable

I’ve noticed that in the real world, where a circle doesn’t exists but a ball does, we see way more gradients than flat colors. Every lemon has its shady half which is more brown or green. Same in flowers, the sky, different materials, and more. They are all painted with gradients. Maybe it might be more natural and logic for our eyes to see gradients also on our screens.

paragraphs.name: 9dd4
paragraphs.text: Gradients are something we don’t see a lot, our eyes catch them as something new, and being memorable is exactly what you want for your design or brand identity. We remember these unusual visuals much better because we aren’t used to see them yet. We are surrounded by a very limited amount of usual and flat colors, we all know them since we were babies and we recognize them in an instance.

3b2d7649f10c.title: Gradients are not new in design—but I do think we’ve gotten better at how we apply them and…

paragraphs.text: Gradients are not new in design—but I do think we’ve gotten better at how we apply them and simplify them so they aren’t overbearing.

1b33ba8b012.title: Well said, I think it might be the ‘last’ trend before something really different will come forward…

paragraphs.name: 7ce7
paragraphs.text: Well said, I think it might be the ‘last’ trend before something really different will come forward.. what I mean is — we’re just upon the edge of something new — like the day before everybody started to use the flat UI, the bold headers, the white big spaces… we’ve seen it all — and gradient is the last thing to change something from flat white UI…

663ce5eddb4f.title: I love your comments on creating gradients of color…adding to the 20 or so colors more familiar to…

paragraphs.name: 185f
paragraphs.text: I love your comments on creating gradients of color…adding to the 20 or so colors more familiar to homo sapiens. My only suggestion is hire a proof reader to help you better communicate ideas using the basics of grammar. E.B. White would suggest you match subject of a sentence with the verb and maintain verb tense as appropriate throughout your entry…past, present, future.

paragraphs.name: c26f
paragraphs.text: So trendy

paragraphs.name: f915
paragraphs.text: Gradients bring depth too. ☺

c045f31e4535.title: It could even be called a fad instead of a trend.

paragraphs.text: It could even be called a fad instead of a trend. When we all first got Macs, the coolest thing we could do was a gradient, then it became derided as hokey and an easy, so-called problem solver—“Mac it up!” I don’t expect gradients lasting too long, because they all start to look alike.

449cc0bee6d0.title: This in itself suggests that if we use them as the new colours they will become old very quickly…

paragraphs.name: f57d
paragraphs.text: This in itself suggests that if we use them as the new colours they will become old very quickly and less memorable.

c2a41b14c555.title: Gradients also allow designers to play with light values, which is very instinctual for the human…

paragraphs.name: a69f
paragraphs.text: Gradients also allow designers to play with light values, which is very instinctual for the human eye to detect. The gradient trend wave is one I’m definitely loving.

5aa46504a019.title: If you notice, nature has gradients.

paragraphs.name: 5f9e
paragraphs.text: If you notice, nature has gradients. The beautiful blending makes me wonder. Maybe it’s also very vital in our lives, that we include gradients. They show growth, change and newness. Besides, there’s no limit to what you can mix in gradients. That just the best part. Thank you for this article.

9b479e939c9d.title: Gradients feel realistic because it simulates the light and shadow.

paragraphs.text: Gradients feel realistic because it simulates the light and shadow. As humans, we tend to feel more comfortable with things that seem touchable.

fddf0b0e345b.title: It’s interesting how polarizing certain types of fit and finish become, demonized and then revered…

paragraphs.text: It’s interesting how polarizing certain types of fit and finish become, demonized and then revered again. I was never a fan of wood texture, green felt, or buttons that look like gel cold medicine capsules in UIs. However there’s nothing wrong with using gradients, drop shadows or texture to aid in better communication and reduce user friction…

891d9249469b.title: Yes it is definitly a trend, but one trend I like much.

paragraphs.name: 26f1
paragraphs.text: Yes it is definitly a trend, but one trend I like much. I noticed that I am guilty of using it to, like my new sites. Online it works nice (and I am glad it isn’t used anymore to give cheap 3d effects on objects), but as Identity it is kinda hard I think, how wel does it work on print? I can imaging that it doesn’t work great outdoors above a shop or something like that.

paragraphs.name: f146
paragraphs.text: Hi Gal,

paragraphs.name: a777
paragraphs.text: Thank you for your opinion on gradients. I’ve been thinking about using gradients within my own brand identity, yet there is a difference between a longterm brand identity and a trendy one. I think flat colours maintain a longer life existence. But i believe that indeed a gradient can 1) attract more attention and 2…
